page.title: 02THE HEALTH CENTRE IN HESSLE
page.content: The Health Centre, built in 1972 and costing Â£77000 plus Â£9000 for equipment, is a purpose-built 2 storey building in the centre of Hessle Square. It has 23000 patients whose medical records are kept in the centre. It opens Monday to Friday 8.15a.m. to 6p.m. and Saturday mornings. There are 9 doctors,14 nurses,2 dentists,a chiropodist, physiotherapist, dietician, speech therapist, eye specialist, psychiatrist, marriage guidance counsellor, and several health visitors. Most people using the centre are young parents and children. There are family planning and ante-natal clinics and twice weekly there is a baby clinic. Families are visited in their own homes where necessary and physical aid equipment(e.g. walking frames, feeding cups) are loaned out.
